title: Porter Airlines is increasing service between Boston and Canada
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Porter Airlines will add new direct flights from Boston to Montréal and Toronto starting May 14, 2026.
Boston-Montréal route will operate 7 times weekly, while Boston-Toronto Pearson route will run 14 times weekly.
Porter's expansion includes 78-seat De Havilland Dash 8-400 and 132-seat Embraer E195-E2 aircraft.

title: Healey signs collaboration agreement with Denmark amid Greenland tensions
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Governor Maura Healey signed a collaboration agreement with Denmark focused on research, innovation, and business cooperation.
The signing comes amid U.S.-Denmark tensions over President Trump's proposal for American ownership of Greenland.
Denmark is a key trading partner for Massachusetts, accounting for approximately $250 million in annual trade.

title: Traveling to Super Bowl LX? Here’s what to see and do in Santa Clara.
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Santa Clara offers free attractions such as the Intel Museum and the 52-acre Central Park for Super Bowl visitors.
The Global Games Food Trail features 24 diverse dining options near Levi's Stadium for culinary enthusiasts.
California's Great America amusement park in Santa Clara features the Gold Striker, a fast wooden rollercoaster.

title: What Boston looked like in 2019 when the Patriots last won the Super Bowl
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: The Patriots celebrated their sixth Super Bowl win with a parade in Boston on February 5, 2019.
In 2019, Marty Walsh was Boston's mayor, and Governor Charlie Baker had just been re-elected.
Elizabeth Warren launched her 2020 presidential campaign in Lawrence, Mass., shortly after the Patriots' victory.

title: Officer and civilian shot, suspect killed in Spencer
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Suspect Patrick Madison shot a civilian on Main Street, Spencer, before fleeing and barricading in a Family Dollar bathroom.
An exchange of gunfire with police left Madison dead and a Millbury police officer injured inside the Family Dollar.
The shooting victim and the injured officer were transported to hospitals; investigation by State and Spencer police continues.

title: Cape Cod house with Watergate ties falls victim to eroding bluff
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Demolition began on Feb. 3, 2026, for Bartlett House at 40 Ocean View Drive in Eastham due to bluff erosion.
Built in 1960, the Bartlett House was linked to the Watergate scandal, used by Nixon's aides for planning.
Demolition includes dust and debris mitigation; the site will be replanted with native vegetation post-demolition.

title: UMass Lowell wants to make the city a destination with a new rink and hotel
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: UMass Lowell plans to build a new ice rink and hotel to attract more visitors and students to Lowell.
The projects aim to enhance Lowell's appeal by providing more venues for events and much-needed downtown accommodations.
UMass Lowell is collaborating with city, state, and private partners as part of the Lowell Innovation Network Corridor initiative.

title: Judge drops assault charge against former City Hall staffer
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Assault charge against former Boston City Hall staffer Chulan Huang dropped due to victim's absence in court.
Incident involved Huang's girlfriend Marwa Khudaynazar and city official Segun Idowu, who was found not to violate policies.
Khudaynazar sues city for alleged retaliatory firing; her assault trial set for next month in Boston Municipal Court.

title: This Rowley inn is the perfect place for romance
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Briar Barn Inn in Rowley was highlighted by The Hotel Guru for a romantic Valentine’s Day getaway.
JetBlue and Delta Air Lines were ranked among the safest for 2026 by AirlineRatings.com.
Great Wolf Lodge is offering a one-day flash sale on Feb. 6, with rates of $26 per night.

title: A dispute over a shoveled-out parking space led to a stabbing in Dorchester, police say
author: John Waller
bullets: A dispute over a shoveled-out parking space in Dorchester led to a stabbing early Wednesday morning.
Two individuals suffered hand injuries and were taken to hospitals after an altercation with Enel Javier.
Enel Javier, 47, was arrested and charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon causing serious injury.
